post.author: asmodeus
post.body:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KDmNk23vEYI

She knows all about foreign policy because she is next door to Russia...

post.author: aardwolf
post.body: Im sure she has as much knowledge about foreign policy as most artic bears. And penguins too probably. But that doesnt matter, she'll pick things up on the way, right?

post.author: rcumps01
post.body: How much foreign policy experience does Obama have? He doesn't even know how many states there are, so I think he should focus on that first.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
You can have all the experience and smarts in the world but it doesn't mean anything if your judgment sucks.

Palin spent $50k on decorating her office. I shouldn't have to explain why that's ridiculously stupid.

McCain is undeserving of his nickname "maverick". He is a completely different person to the McCain that ran in 2000 and seems to have changed his position for no other reason than to appeal to the neoconservatives that have taken over the republican party.

Obama puts on a great show but doesn't have the gall to back it up. He gave in to FISA because he's unprincipled and weak.

Damn them all. They all suck. Vote third party.

post.author: stabinbac
post.body:
WTF?!

A video of some dumbass on a semi-retarded news channel? If I start making ridiculous claims about Obama can I use those to trash him like he said it? It's ridiculously childish.

She's still the only one to ever be a governor.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: I sent an email to BNA once or twice. I have foreign relations experience.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I sent an email to BNA once or twice. I have foreign relations experience.


Just like me for the same reason

We can declare us being bilateral experts now. And since I live in Germany which is the country that shares the second most number of borderlines with other countries (only Russia has more neighbors) I can brag on that too as foreign policy experience. That also elevates Rich into the top notch tier of being a whole European expert.

post.author: wal
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
Damn them all. They all suck. Vote third party.
A recent pole found that around 80% of British people prefer Nick Clegg to Gorden Brown and David Cameran but only 20% are going to vote for the Liberal Democrats because they feel that voting for the third party is a waist. This is where democracy falls down. I gather the same applies to the US except it doesn't have a strong third party. We do, ish but they still wont get in. It's a huge flaw in people, not the system but I can't see it ever changing.

Btw, happy birthday chief and thanks for making me feel young.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
wal wrote:
Btw, happy birthday chief and thanks for making me feel young.


Thanks

post.author: asmodeus
post.body:
stabinbac wrote:
WTF?!

A video of some dumbass on a semi-retarded news channel? If I start making ridiculous claims about Obama can I use those to trash him like he said it? It's ridiculously childish.

She's still the only one to ever be a governor.


Most people would have watched the video, laughed their ass off at the absurdity of the claim, and then gone on about their lives, partisans take it personally because they don't want to admit that their candidate sucks and will screw them over just as much as the other guy.

post.author: Hostyle
post.body: It's not about the president, its about who's the vice-president or adviser. Dick cheney and Zbignev Brezinsky are/will be teh real presidents... And those Palins/Bushes/Obamas are just puppets.

post.author: leifhv
post.body: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2008/09/2 ... 29318.html

post.author: stabinbac
post.body:
I enjoy the fact that she speaks like a human. She handled the question horribly though.

I hate Couric. She's so faked and forced. She seems incredibly arrogant, and really only has her job because 9/11 took place during her morning show. She's like an amateur who has to fool herself into thinking she's amazing or she'll fall apart.
